BERN, Switzerland, May 22 -- On a crisp spring afternoon, nearly a hundred tea lovers from around the world gathered not in a traditional teahouse, but on the windswept peak of the Grindelwald-First mountain in Switzerland's Bernese Oberland. The fragrant aroma of jasmine and roasted oolong mingled with the alpine air in a cross-cultural celebration of International Tea Day, held on Wednesday. https://english.news.cn/20250523/ba7db8d6670f4e1195843dade9a8c717/c.html

Cantonese embroidery, one of China's four famous embroidery styles, traces its origins back to the Tang Dynasty (618-907), when embroidery craftsmanship in Guangdong was already well developed. Guangzhou and Chaozhou became the main production centers, with products popular both domestically and abroad, highly favored by Western aristocrats. Whether depicting flowers, birds, fish, insects, or figures and landscapes, Cantonese embroidery showcases unique artistic charm through exquisite stitching techniques.#China #CantoneseEmbroidery #GreaterBayArea #Culture

Gold-threaded jade burial suits, exclusive to emperors and nobles, were created from thousands of jade plaques and gold thread, symbolizing immortality and nobility. The Henan Museum's 2,008-plaque gold-threaded jade burial suit vividly reflects Han Dynasty's life-and-death beliefs. Despite not being the earliest example, this burial wear, which was uncovered from a Han tomb located in Shangqiu, Henan province, is notable for being completely restored with intact jade pieces. #CulturalJourney

Two New Species Discovered in Hainan's Rainforests! The Hainan Provincial Department of Ecology and Environment announced the discovery of two previously unknown species during a year-long biodiversity survey. The findings were officially announced last Friday in Sanya City.The newly identified species include:â€¢ Ganoderma baisuzhenii, a medicinal mushroom named after the Chinese legendary figure Bai Suzhenâ€¢ Craterellus albimarginatus, an edible fungus distinguished by its white-edged capBoth discoveries have been published in scientific journals:â€¢ Ganoderma baisuzhenii in Journal of Fungiâ€¢ Craterellus albimarginatus in LifeThe comprehensive survey also documented significant findings:â€¢ 35 species not previously recorded in Chinaâ€¢ 71 species observed in Hainan for the first timeThese remarkable findings underscore the incredible biodiversity of Hainan's tropical rainforest ecosystem.Photo: Hainan Provincial Department of Ecology and Environment#Biodiversityday #NewSpecies #ScientificDiscovery #Hainan #RainforestConservation

Cantonese embroidery, one of China's four famous embroidery styles, traces its origins back to the Tang Dynasty (618-907), when embroidery craftsmanship in Guangdong was already well developed. Guangzhou and Chaozhou became the main production centers, with products popular both domestically and abroad, highly favored by Western aristocrats. Whether depicting flowers, birds, fish, insects, or figures and landscapes, Cantonese embroidery showcases unique artistic charm through exquisite stitching techniques.#China #CantoneseEmbroidery #GreaterBayArea #Culture

Niue is located in the south-central Pacific Ocean, bordered by Tonga to the west, Samoa to the north and the Cook Islands to the east. Its capital is Alofi.Niue is home to the world's second-largest emerging coral atoll and is affectionately known as the 'Reef of Polynesia.' The island's main industries include agriculture, tourism and fisheries. The people of Niue are known for their sincerity and hospitality, embodying the vibrant spirit of the South Pacific.As night falls, Niue enforces a strict 'lights out' policy to minimize artificial lighting and preserve its natural night environment. In recognition of its exceptional commitment to reducing light pollution and protecting the night sky, the International Dark-Sky Association designated Niue as the world's first official 'Dark Sky Nation.' This prestigious title not only highlights the island's outstanding stargazing conditions and pristine skies but also reflects Niue's dedication to preserving the beauty of its natural environment. #ChinaPacific2025

A new jewel has been added to the crown of global agricultural heritage. On May 19, the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (#FAO) announced the addition of the Zhejiang Deqing Freshwater Pearl Mussel Composite Fishery System, also known as the Deqing Pearl System, to the Globally Important Agricultural Heritage Systems (GIAHS) list for 2025. This designation makes it China's first world-class agricultural heritage project in aquaculture. China now has 25 of these systems, the highest number in the world, with six located in Zhejiang alone.

Significant ecological progress has been achieved in the upper Yangtze River, with biodiversity steadily recovering due to coordinated efforts in pollution control and ecological water management. In Wushan County of Chongqing Municipality, a daily cleanup system combining machines and manual labor removes over 20 tonnes of floating debris, reducing microplastic pollution and improving water quality. Meanwhile, the Three Gorges Group has advanced ecological scheduling, aiding reproduction of key fish species and releasing over 6.5 million Chinese sturgeon and nearly 2 million Yangtze sturgeon into the river. Vegetation restoration has also boosted habitats for birds and rare plants. The region's ecosystem continues to improve, supported by a rare plant conservation base that houses 2,080 species.

Together, these three sectors form the pillars of the nation's economy, driving growth and providing a solid foundation for local livelihoods.This tropical paradise is not only celebrated for its breathtaking natural beauty but also for its rich cultural heritage. The Federated States of Micronesia continues to shine as one of the Pacific's most vibrant and meaningful destinations. #ChinaPacific2025 #Oceania #islandlifestyle #pacificocean #travelgram

The Independent State of Papua New Guinea (PNG) lies in the southwestern Pacific, sharing a border with Indonesia to the west and separated from Australia by the Torres Strait to the south. Covering 462,800 square kilometers, it is the largest and most populous nation among the Pacific Island countries. Its capital is Port Moresby. PNG became one of the first Pacific nations to establish diplomatic ties with the People's Republic of China on October 12, 1976.Made up of over 600 islands, PNG is a breathtaking land of volcanoes, rainforests, waterfalls and winding rivers â€“ often hailed as a "paradise unlike any other." It is also one of the most culturally diverse countries in the world, home to more than 800 languages and 1,000 distinct tribes, each with its own unique customs shaped by geography and tradition.In daily life, most locals wear modern clothing. But during festivals, weddings or special ceremonies, they proudly don traditional outfits, vibrant feathered headdresses and intricate face paint, bringing their tribal dances and cultural heritage to life with color and rhythm. #ChinaPacific2025 #Oceania #islandlifestyle #pacificocean #travelgram

The Hanging Temple in north China's Shanxi Province appears to have no visible support, suspended 60 meters above ground. Its weight-bearing secret lies in horizontally chiseled rock cavities. Builders inserted specially treated wood beams through these square holes to create a foundation platform. The entire temple structure rests on these rock-embedded beams, functioning similarly to modern cantilevered balconies. Notably, the vertical poles beneath the temple are decorative rather than structural supports. This ingenious beam-in-cliff design has maintained the temple's stability for over 1,500 years. #CivilizationsShine

The Longmen Grottoes, located in central #China's Henan Province, are one of the country's four most famous grottoes and represent the pinnacle of Chinese stone carving. Their construction began in the late 5th century during the reign of Emperor Xiaowen of the Northern Wei Dynasty (386â€“534 AD).Situated on both sides of the Yihe River, the grottoes house thousands of caves and niches, along with nearly 110,000 Buddhist stone statues, serving as a monumental testament to Chinese Buddhist art.Inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage List in 2000, the Longmen Grottoes have long been a popular tourist destination, especially for enthusiasts of Chinese history and art. As night falls, visitors can enjoy a uniquely enchanting experience. #ChinaSeen

Niue is located in the south-central Pacific Ocean, bordered by Tonga to the west, Samoa to the north and the Cook Islands to the east. Its capital is Alofi.Niue is home to the world's second-largest emerging coral atoll and is affectionately known as the 'Reef of Polynesia.' The island's main industries include agriculture, tourism and fisheries. The people of Niue are known for their sincerity and hospitality, embodying the vibrant spirit of the South Pacific.As night falls, Niue enforces a strict 'lights out' policy to minimize artificial lighting and preserve its natural night environment. In recognition of its exceptional commitment to reducing light pollution and protecting the night sky, the International Dark-Sky Association designated Niue as the world's first official 'Dark Sky Nation.' This prestigious title not only highlights the island's outstanding stargazing conditions and pristine skies but also reflects Niue's dedication to preserving the beauty of its natural environment. #ChinaPacific2025

U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday revoked Harvard University's certification under the Student and Exchange Visitor Program, effectively blocking the institution from enrolling international students, a move that could affect about a quarter of the university's students. He argued that the U.S. thrives by bringing together people from around the world and should preserve this diversity.

During the Han Dynasty (206 BC-AD 220), jade burial culture flourished. Gold-threaded jade burial suits, exclusive to emperors and nobles, were created from thousands of jade plaques and gold thread, symbolizing immortality and nobility. The Henan Museum's 2,008-plaque gold-threaded jade burial suit vividly reflects Han Dynasty's life-and-death beliefs. Despite not being the earliest example, this burial wear, which was uncovered from a Han tomb located in Shangqiu, Henan province, is notable for being completely restored with intact jade pieces. #CulturalJourney

Cantonese embroidery, one of China's four famous embroidery styles, traces its origins back to the Tang Dynasty (618-907), when embroidery craftsmanship in Guangdong was already well developed. Guangzhou and Chaozhou became the main production centers, with products popular both domestically and abroad, highly favored by Western aristocrats. Whether depicting flowers, birds, fish, insects, or figures and landscapes, Cantonese embroidery showcases unique artistic charm through exquisite stitching techniques.#China #CantoneseEmbroidery #GreaterBayArea #Culture

Two New Species Discovered in Hainan's Rainforests! The Hainan Provincial Department of Ecology and Environment announced the discovery of two previously unknown species during a year-long biodiversity survey. The findings were officially announced last Friday in Sanya City.The newly identified species include:â€¢ Ganoderma baisuzhenii, a medicinal mushroom named after the Chinese legendary figure Bai Suzhenâ€¢ Craterellus albimarginatus, an edible fungus distinguished by its white-edged capBoth discoveries have been published in scientific journals:â€¢ Ganoderma baisuzhenii in Journal of Fungiâ€¢ Craterellus albimarginatus in LifeThe comprehensive survey also documented significant findings:â€¢ 35 species not previously recorded in Chinaâ€¢ 71 species observed in Hainan for the first timeThese remarkable findings underscore the incredible biodiversity of Hainan's tropical rainforest ecosystem.Photo: Hainan Provincial Department of Ecology and Environment#Biodiversityday #NewSpecies #ScientificDiscovery #Hainan #RainforestConservation

Cantonese embroidery, one of China's four famous embroidery styles, traces its origins back to the Tang Dynasty (618-907), when embroidery craftsmanship in Guangdong was already well developed. Guangzhou and Chaozhou became the main production centers, with products popular both domestically and abroad, highly favored by Western aristocrats. Whether depicting flowers, birds, fish, insects, or figures and landscapes, Cantonese embroidery showcases unique artistic charm through exquisite stitching techniques.#China #CantoneseEmbroidery #GreaterBayArea #Culture

International Healthcare Week (#IHW) launched in Hong Kong on Monday, featuring two major events at the Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre. The fifth Asia Summit on Global Health (May 26-27) convenes over 80 international healthcare leaders discussing medical technology, elderly health, and healthcare systems development. Simultaneously, the Hong Kong International Medical and Healthcare Fair (May 26-28) showcases cutting-edge medical technologies from nearly 300 exhibitors across 13 countries and regions, highlighting innovations in aging care and sustainable healthcare solutions while fostering global industry collaboration. The Peacock Banquet is a captivating culinary tradition among the Dai ethnic group in Yunnan province. Featuring grilled fish, barbecued meats, pineapple rice, bamboo tube rice, and an array of side dishes, the meal is elegantly arranged to form the shape of a peacock, a revered symbol of grace and hospitality in Dai culture. This visually stunning dining experience reimagines traditional Dai cuisine, inviting diners to savor each component by hand, fostering a direct connection with the rich flavors and textures. Originally crafted to suit local palates, Dai cuisine has evolved alongside Yunnan's thriving tourism industry, becoming a celebrated showcase of local culture. #food #CulturalJourney

China sent a new communication satellite into orbit Tuesday from the Wenchang Space Launch Site on the coast of the southern island province of Hainan.The ChinaSat 3B satellite was launched at 7:50 p.m. (Beijing Time) aboard a Long March-7A carrier rocket. The launch marked the 577th mission of the Long March series carrier rockets. (Source: Xinhua)
